explains: vt. 擦破；擦热；擦痛；激怒
n. （Chafe）人名；（尼日利）沙费；（英）蔡菲

sentences.en: His wrists began to chafe against the cloth strips binding them.
sentences.cn: 他的手腕开始被绑着的布带子擦痛了。

sentences.en: She must suspect and guess and chafe and bear it all alone .
sentences.cn: 她只能怀疑，猜测，焦躁，独自忍受着这一切。

sentences.en: Electorates are likely to chafe at the cost of bringing down government deficits, especially if the main result is to repay foreign creditors.
sentences.cn: 以削减赤字为代价有可能会激怒选民，特别是在赤字是用于偿还外债的情况下。
